page.title: 05FARMING..
page.content: Up until 1957 horses were used as working animals on farms in this area. The introduction of machinery has had an impact not only on the number of farm workers but also on the occupancy of farm cottagesand on the number of children attending rural primary schools. In 1950 a 170 acre farm in the area had 5 farm workers, yet in 1985 with the farm now 600 acres in size, only 2 farm workers were employed. Machinery found on a typical 600 acre farm is:- 3 tractors:2 cultivators;1 plough;1 drain drill;1 sprayer;1 combine;1 round bailer;1 muck spreader;1 slury whisk;1 slury pump;1 slury tanker;1 grain dryer;1 landrover;1 truck. Where specialised machinery is needed agricultural contractors are then employed.
